# Test Fixtures

<!-- DONE [Step 1.C1]: Directory populated with synthetic test files. -->

This directory holds sample Excel files used by the automated test suite.
Files are generated by `scripts/generate_expected_output.py`.

## Contents

### Excel Fixtures

| File | Exhibit | Service | Rows | Description |
|------|---------|---------|-----:|-------------|
| `army_p1_fy2026.xlsx` | P-1 | Army | 3 | Procurement summary (Aircraft) |
| `navy_r1_fy2026.xlsx` | R-1 | Navy | 2 | RDT&E summary (Basic/Applied Research) |
| `army_p5_fy2026.xlsx` | P-5 | Army | 2 | Procurement detail (line items) |
| `army_r2_fy2026.xlsx` | R-2 | Army | 2 | RDT&E detail schedule |

### Expected Output (`expected/`)

Each `.xlsx` fixture has a corresponding `*_expected.json` file documenting
the expected parse result (exhibit type, detected columns, sample values).

## Naming Convention

```
{service}_{exhibit_type}_fy{year}.xlsx
```

## Regenerating Fixtures

```bash
python scripts/generate_expected_output.py
```

To regenerate to a different directory:

```bash
python scripts/generate_expected_output.py --output-dir /path/to/fixtures
```

## Size Target

Keep this directory under 50 MB so tests remain fast. Current synthetic
fixtures are <100 KB total.
